item.title: Notes about Migrating from Qwerty to Dvorak
item.description: Windows Newer versions of Windows could use different keyboard layouts for the login screen. Just choose it when installing or add the relevant input method in language settings. Linux Newer versions of Linux distributions also support dvorak layout when installing. If you want to set the layout temporarily, you could also use the following commands: setxkbmap dvorak # change to dvorak setxkbmap us # change back to qwerty Xrdp If you are using rdp to connect to remote linux servers, the keyboard layout is controlled by a separate configuration file.
